headline: US no longer accuses Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro of leading the 'Cartel de los Soles'
description: The indictment against the former Venezuelan president, presented by US authorities on Monday, no longer includes the accusation from five years ago, which had until recently been claimed by the Trump administration.

headline: Trump weighs 'range of options' for acquiring Greenland, including military ones
description: Donald Trump is looking at ideas for acquiring the Danish territory and using the US military is 'always an option,' the White House said on Tuesday. Earlier, Greenland and Denmark called for a meeting with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio after Trump's renewed claims.

headline: Iran risks losing a key economic and military ally in Venezuela
description: Tehran and Caracas have maintained close ties with each other, notably to circumvent the sanctions against both countries. Iran, which has also come under threat from Washington, has projected a facade of optimism.

headline: Trump says Venezuela is 'turning over' up to 50 million barrels of oil to US
description: The US president, in a post on Truth Social on Tuesday, said 'that money will be controlled by me' and that he will 'ensure it is used to benefit the people of Venezuela and the United States.'

headline: Roberto Saviano, writer: 'Venezuela is not a narco-state, but a state that uses drugs as an instrument for the survival of those in power'
description: Western democracies have allowed the regime to survive, enabling it to strengthen itself by becoming increasingly criminalized. Today, Venezuela acts as a hub state, exhibiting advanced forms of narco-structuring, writes the author of 'Gomorrah.'

headline: Saudi-led coalition strikes Yemen as separatist leader flees
After tragedy at Swiss resort bar, residents express 'anger' and 'shame'
AFCON 2025: Algeria reaches quarterfinals, Côte d'Ivoire also advances
Cold snap hits Paris's homeless population hard
Ukraine's Western allies agree on key security guarantees in Paris
France's political parties divided over US operation in Venezuela
Reviving Venezuela's oil industry comes at a steep cost
With the Venezuela operation, Marco Rubio is at the heart of reshaping the 'Western Hemisphere'
Maduro, a 'prisoner of war,' proclaims his 'innocence' before New York court
Phil Gunson: If Trump does not force Venezuela to hold free elections, 'they can agree on almost everything'
Deep freeze grips Europe, killing six and disrupting travel
EU offers extra funds to quell farmer anger over Mercosur trade deal
'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
description: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

headline: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
description: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

headline: They cook organic, distrust science and oppose vaccines: America's 'crunchy moms' shift toward Trump
description: In the 1960s, the 'crunchy mom' was typically an American hippie trying to stay connected to nature. Today, she claims total freedom over health decisions, sometimes flirting with conspiracy theories.

headline: Greenland is and must remain European
The return of the US's predatory imperialism
'Trump and Putin share a common enemy, liberal Europe, but they have two divergent strategic projects'
